Package com.rotartsi.jgame.game

Class State

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rotartsi.jgame.game.State
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ButtonTestState, MainState, PlayerTest.PlayerTestState, WindowCaptureState
    public class State
extends Object
    Support for different "states" of a game.

    The game will execute different main loop code and handle events differently in different states.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  State.KeyHandler
      Handles all key events.
      class  State.MenuHandler
      Menu to be displayed.
      class  State.MouseHandler
      Handles all mouse events

    • Constructor Detail

      • State

        public State​(Game parent)
        New state!
        Parameters:
        parent - The Game object.

    • Method Detail

      • handleRepaint

        public void handleRepaint()
        Draw the game to the screen. Call's the game.repaint() function which in turn calls the updateGraphics(Graphics) function.

        This is rather resource intensive and should be ticked less than updateLogic().

      • getKeyHandlers

        public State.KeyHandler[] getKeyHandlers()
        Get the handler instance that should be invoked for key events.
        Returns:
        Key handler.

      • getMouseHandlers

        public State.MouseHandler[] getMouseHandlers()
        Get the handler instance that should be invoked for mouse events.
        Returns:
        Mouse handler.

      • getMenuHandler

        public State.MenuHandler getMenuHandler()
        Get the State.MenuHandler instance to use. (which is a glorified JMenuBar)
        Returns:
        Menu bar.

      • getScreenSize

        public Dimension getScreenSize()
        Get the available space for blitting. (This is the size of the JFrame)
        Returns:
        Dimensions of the JFrame

      • getDisplaySize

        public Dimension getDisplaySize()
        Get the size of the physical display as opposed to the window.
        Returns:
        Dimensions of physical display

      • setCursor

        public void setCursor​(int cursor)
        Set the cursor. Passed into Cursor.getPredefinedCursor(cursor) See Cursor
        Parameters:
        cursor - predefined cursor id

      • updateLogic

        public void updateLogic()
        Update game logic. No graphical updates.

      • enter

        public void enter​(String old_state)
        Called whenever the Game's state to this state.
        Parameters:
        old_state - The state that the game was updated from.

      • exit

        public void exit​(String new_state)
        Called whenever the Game's state is updated from this state.
        Parameters:
        new_state - The state that the game was updated to.

      • updateGraphics

        public void updateGraphics​(Graphics g)
        Draw things to the screen! Graphical updates here!
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics to draw to.
